description: From Middle English virginite, from Old French virginite, from Latin virginitas. Equivalent to virgin +‎ -ity. Displaced native Old English mæġeþhād, originally meaning “girlhood.”

entries.meaning: The state or characteristic of being a virgin.
examples: Synonyms: maidenhood, maidenhead, (female) maidhood, (euphemistic, general) V card, (informal) cherry
